title: Bill against Fugitive Slave Act introduced in New York Legislature
content: A small portion of the New York Legislature pushed for a bill which was against the Fugitive Slave Act.  A similar Bill had been passed earlier in Vermont.  The main conflict in this situation is difference between a state and federal law, which takes precedence etc.  The South was using the power of the Federal government to keep the Fugitive Slave Act alive.<br />Shortly after these Bills against the Fugitive Slave Act were created, the Free states created Personal-Liberty laws. These laws extended legal rights to fugitive slaves in Northern states.  Wisconsin even went a step further and ruled that the Fugitive Slave Act was void in their state because it was contrary to state law.

data: James A. Henretta, David Brody, Lynn Dumenil, and Susan Ware

course.name: Rise And Fall of the Slave South
